<p><b>You can be part of an inclusive team of diverse talent and character. In this diversity lies our greatest strength.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>At BASF<\u002Fb>, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We provide a fulfilling work environment with a strong emphasis on the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in. We are always working to form the best team with an emphasis on diversity, equity and inclusion and through lifelong learning and development.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been proudly recognized as one of Canada's &amp; GTA’s Best 100 Employers in 2022 and for many consecutive years. We have also recently been honored as one of Canada’s Safest Employers in addition to a Bronze winner of the Psychologically Safe Workplace award.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We invite you to join our best team on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>AgSolutions Grower Representative (2300048) – Saskatoon, SK<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Where the Chemistry Happens…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Reporting to the Regional Sales Manager, the primary role of the AgSolutions Grower Representative is to drive accelerated sales growth of BASF’s new innovations to assigned growers. In addition, the successful candidate will be charged with developing, cultivating, and maintaining business relationships with top growers, working effectively with retail partners, and managing relationships within the channel.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>The AgSolutions Grower Representative will also actively prospect for new business to expand their customer base. The ideal candidate will have a strong market and customer focus with ability to translate information into clear business strategies to generate growth.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Formula for Success: You Will…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Gain comprehensive understanding of products, applications, and territory needs as it relates to BASF’s Agricultural product portfolio.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Drive \"hunting\" efforts to grow future business in the Agricultural segment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Identify, negotiate, and close new opportunities for our products.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Increase market intelligence by providing information around industries, competitors, and customers to BASF’s Marketing team.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor’s degree required, with a concentration in Agronomy, Chemistry, Biology, Business, or a related field.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>A minimum of 3 years of professional experience in sales, or a technical background within an agricultural-related field including, but not limited to, seed, chemical, equipment, or crop consulting.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Strong interpersonal communication skills combined with a passion for making a positive difference in the agriculture industry; Assisting with seed storage, entry of data into seed inventory computers and tracking of seed within the greenhouse and movement to other departments.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Liaise and support breeding and lab functions to ensure completion of project as required quality standards and timelines and to ensure the integrity of breeding material across functions by assisting other employees with the details of the associated projects as activities (planting, harvesting and tissue sampling).\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Ensure all activities are carried out in support of health and safety guidelines, quality management, SOP’s and WI’s, breeding protocols and other internal and external regulations and practices as well as participation in the development and improvements of all the above processes as required. \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in field.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <i>Experience<\u002Fi>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Entry level.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Experience in plant care and working in greenhouse production an asset.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <i>Knowledge\u002FSkills<\u002Fi>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Basic computer <p><b>You can be part of an inclusive team of diverse talent and character. In this diversity lies our greatest strength.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>At BASF,<\u002Fb> we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We provide a fulfilling work environment with a strong emphasis on the physical and psychological safety of our employees and the communities we operate in. We are always working to form the best team with an emphasis on diversity, equity and inclusion and through lifelong learning and development.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF Canada has been proudly recognized as one of Canada's &amp; GTA’s Best 100 Employers in 2022 and for many consecutive years. We have also been recognized as Canada’s Safest Employer in Chemical Manufacturing for several consecutive years, in addition to receiving a Bronze medal for providing a Psychologically Safe workplace. Most recently, we were thrilled to be recognized as a Forbes 2022 Canada’s Best Employers for Diversity.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We invite you to join our best team on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Seeds Processing Supervisor II LETH (2203690) – Lethbridge, AB<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Where the Chemistry Happens…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>This position is directly accountable to the Seed Processing Managers of the Lethbridge Seed Processing Facility for supervising and organizing the activities of the Seasonal Cleaning and Packing Team Leads and their Seasonal Teams in the processing (cleaning) of hybrid canola seed for the InVigor market.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>The incumbent will work with the Processing Plant Manager to act as a backup position to the other Area Supervisors &amp; Area Coordinators to cover short-term absences.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Day-to-Day during the canola processing season, the incumbent will predominantly lead a cleaning shift team and will also rotate through the various cleaning shifts as required to ensure that key cleaning elements, critical protocols and QMS expectations are in place on all canola cleaning process team\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Formula for Success: You Will…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Leveraging the information available from the Seed Planners and with guidance from the Seed Processing Manager, the Seed Processing Supervisor will establish the Site production schedule and consequent crewing schedule.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Utilizing the Work Order system, the Seed Processing Supervisor will ensure equipment and maintenance issues are communicated to Reliability Supervisor. The Seed Processing Supervisor will ensure that published performance information flows to the Planners in a timely fashion and accuracy and integrity are maintained.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Coordinate the contract and seasonal employees (Operators). Ensure that they are properly oriented and trained to be able to complete work efficiently adhering to all protocols and standards within the facility.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Analyze the usage of employees, resources and expense budget to select the best way to meet production goals, consult with shift Process Team Leads and advise the Process Managers of recommended actions.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Supervise all seed cleaning processing activities in the facility by utilizing Process Team Leads and Operators on the various shifts. Ensure that production goals will be met, and that all activities are completed as established protocols mandate.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Provide coaching and support to the Process Team Leads and Operators as well as provide feedback on performance to the Cleaning Plant Manager. Ensure effective training and mentoring is provided to Operators and Team Leads, and that competencies are documented.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Monitor the progress of all production processes to make sure that production goals are met, and process schedules is adhered to. Have flexibility to develop plans in case problems arise.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Work with yard team members to manage seed movement in bin farm and utilize bin space and inventory effectively throughout cleaning and summer season. Ensure all domestic and foreign seed is positioned effectively for blending and treating. Observation of master bin map, estimations of daily production for a 24hr – 120hr lead time and all outbound seed for shipments for the various destinations.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Assist in the maintenance and management of the facility’s Health and Safety program consistent with company and legislative requirements and provide feedback on performance to the Process Managers. Ensure safe operating procedures are always adhered to throughout the Processing Department.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Remain current to the latest Processing schedules as published by the Logistics Planners. With guidance from the Processing Managers, develop shift schedules and crewing plans to execute to schedule needs.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Work closely with the Reliability Supervisor in utilizing Work Order management technology to assist in maintaining all equipment in Cleaning to meet scheduling requirements. \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <i>Education<\u002Fi>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Diploma in Certified Engineering Technology, in Business Management, in Journeyman Instrument Technician or equivalent. Education related to seed certification, seed cleaning, seed treating &amp; packaging would also be beneficial.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Certification as an Operator and Grader by CFIA.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Forklift Operator License\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <i>Experience<\u002Fi>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Minimum of 3 years of leadership experience in a production facility.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Experience with data entry, data management, and data analyzing. SAP software knowledge and Microsoft Office 2010 experience would be an asset.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <i>Knowledge\u002FSkills<\u002Fi>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  Ability to identify root causes of process and employee shortfalls and be capable of developing effective solutions.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Strong coaching skills relevant to supervising within a team environment including the ability to motivate and coordinate seasonal staff and to ensure the ongoing performance of seed processing activities.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Ability to work multiple shift schedules and overtime hours to ensure processes are maintained to meet schedules. Some weekend work is required.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Ability to use time management effectively. Capability and flexibility to manage a team in a quickly evolving and ever changing business environment.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Excellent problem solving capability.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. In addition, the position will be responsible for the planning, procurement, and management of all packaging materials for the 3rd party tollers within Canada. This would include creating inventory management strategies and managing the inventory reconciliations and audits at all AP Tolling sites within Canada to ensure inventory is accurate and adequate to ensure production schedules are met. Collaboration and communication between productions sites and supply chain organizations within the North American Region is critical to the success of this position.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Formula for Success: You Will…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Responsible to plan, procure and manage all key raw material inventories for 3rd party tollers and the Regina Production site within AP Canada to ensure timely delivery supporting production schedules and ultimately the sales forecast.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Responsible to plan, procure and manage all packaging material inventories for 3rd party tollers within AP Canada to ensure timely delivery supporting production schedules and ultimately the sales forecast.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Responsible to ensure the key raw materials are strategically located within Canada to meet the production schedules for each facility.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Responsible for the coordination of raw material requirements and supply for production including establishing safety stocks, delivery schedule and managing inventories.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  In collaboration with Tolling and the Regina Site, Site Scheduler, identify and communicate to the Supply Operations team all demand and supply imbalances and risks and coordinate all requests for production schedule changes.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Lead and assign non-conformance (NCM) issues related to 3rd party tolling sites.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Manage all quarterly inventory reconciliation and annual inventory counts at the third-party warehouses.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Work with Procurement to ensure accurate pricing and Outline Agreements.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Ingredients for We have also been recognized as Canada’s Safest Employer in Chemical Manufacturing for several consecutive years, in addition to receiving a Bronze medal for providing a Psychologically Safe workplace. Most recently, we were thrilled to be recognized as a Forbes 2022 Canada’s Best Employers for Diversity.\n <p><\u002Fp> We invite you to join our best team on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Director of Sales – Agricultural Solutions Canada (2203904) Calgary, AB<\u002Fb>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <b><i>Where the Chemistry Happens…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <p><\u002Fp> Reporting to the Vice President of Agricultural Solutions Canada and as part of the Canadian Leadership Team for Agricultural Solutions Canada, the Director of Sales will set the overall strategic direction for how the sales team interacts with targeted retailers and growers across Canada. This role is also part of the Canadian Leadership Team which sets the strategic direction for more than 600 people and all aspects of agricultural business operations in Canada. The Director of Sales will coach and develop an overall sales team of approximately 80 professionals managed by a team of 9 Regional Sales Managers. Sales currently exceed $2 billion and are expected to grow. The role will be based in Calgary, AB.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Formula for Success: You Will…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  Manage a team of approximately 80 sales professionals across Canada that represent greater than 30 leading crop protection brands and InVigor hybrid canola seed. Build, maintain and motivate an organization of sales and sales management personnel to deliver business targets at the Retail and Grower. You will do so within the assigned cost center budget and meet or exceed a profit target to deliver a premium on our cost of capital. Establish and maintain business relationships with key area business managers within the retail distribution system, communicate BASF business strategy, and work to ensure retail partners understand and align with BASF business objectives. Actively participate as a member of the Canadian Leadership Team with the purpose of setting mid to long-term strategy for Canada and delivering a strong sustainable business; you will represent BASF Canada decisions and communications both internally and externally. Identify new business opportunities and work closely with marketing to develop new strategies that grow our business. Represent Agricultural Solutions Canada with key industry associations designed to promote and steward the agriculture industry. \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <i>Education<\u002Fi> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Minimum Bachelor of Business, Science, or a related discipline. \n <\u002Ful>\n <i>Experience<\u002Fi>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  Minimum 15 years of your professional experience in sales, marketing and\u002For technical services.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You<\u002Fb>\n <p><\u002Fp> Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you – the whole you – in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry.\n <p><\u002Fp> The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. The position assumes leadership and accountability for the brand strategy within various crops and segments, ensuring the annual budget is achieved. strategies.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Formula for Success: You Will…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Manage profitability of your respective <p><b>You can be part of an inclusive team of diverse talent and character. In this diversity lies our greatest strength.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>At BASF,<\u002Fb> we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.\n <p><\u002Fp> We provide a fulfilling work environment with a strong emphasis on the physical and psychological safety of our employees and the communities we operate in. We are always working to form the best team with an emphasis on diversity, equity and inclusion and through lifelong learning and development. \n <p><\u002Fp>We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF Canada has been proudly recognized as one of Canada's &amp; GTA’s Best 100 Employers in 2022 and for many consecutive years. We have also been recognized as Canada’s Safest Employer in Chemical Manufacturing for several consecutive years, in addition to receiving a Bronze medal for providing a Psychologically Safe workplace. \n <p><\u002Fp>We invite you to join our best team on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Business Development Manager, Quebec &amp; Eastern Canada – Remote<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Where the Chemistry Happens…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>As Business Development Manager, you will be responsible for the development and execution of market and growth strategy for BASF’s various businesses (ranging from mining, automotive, pharmaceuticals and manufacturing) in Quebec. This will include the development and management of Quebec-based key accounts. As such you will need to be fluent in English and French. \n <p><\u002Fp>You will be responsible to delivering actionable insights, market analysis and competitor intelligence for BASF in Canada using existing data sources and through new primary and secondary research. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We provide a fulfilling work environment with a strong emphasis on the physical and psychological safety of our employees and the communities we operate in. We are always working to form the best team with an emphasis on diversity, equity and inclusion and through lifelong learning and development.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF Canada has been proudly recognized as one of Canada's &amp; GTA’s Best 100 Employers in 2022 and for many consecutive years. We have also been recognized as Canada’s Safest Employer in Chemical Manufacturing for several consecutive years, in addition to receiving a Bronze medal for providing a Psychologically Safe workplace. Most recently, we were thrilled to be recognized as a Forbes 2022 Canada’s Best Employers for Diversity.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We invite you to join our best team on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Strategic Account Manager East (2203625) - Ontario<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Posting Closes Friday, December 9th.<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Where the Chemistry Happens…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>The Strategic Accounts Manager is responsible for driving accelerated growth of BASF’s agricultural product portfolio to designated distribution management; maintaining and building good business\u002Ftrade relationships with designated distributors and linked accounts. Collaboration with key personnel regarding business planning\u002Fimplementation, product support\u002Fselling; assisting the National Account Manager with linked customer contact, meeting and call preparation in addition to various administrative and special project responsibilities. The Strategic Accounts Manager is the central and coordinating BASF contact for all facets of the BASF business relationship with designated distribution.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Formula for Success: You Will…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Call on designated distributors to communicate the value of BASF’s products.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Develop a value based Strategic Account Plan for each designated customer based on their unique needs, interests, and business goals and objectives in order to maximize sales opportunities.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Implement and execute the account plan in order to yield maximum sales and meet or exceed sales goals.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Develop and maintain good business &amp; trade relationships with designated distributors and any linked associated accounts or contacts, including Head Offices to field related contacts.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Develop annual on ground sales plans (POG plans) and financial purchase plans for designated channel partners. Early on and ahead of the campaign season.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Ensure clear communication and fulfilment of all marketing letter requirements.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Communicate and promote BASF marketing, sales and technical programs to designated accounts and key personnel in order to drive business and achieve sales goals.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  The Strategic Account Plan should define the potential of the designated accounts establish the priority coverage for accounts through appropriate call frequency and geographic patterns and market dynamics.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Initiate and coordinate strategic planning sessions with designated accounts that ensure sound business &amp; action plans are developed, implemented and updated on a regional basis.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Take an active role in assisting the National Account Manager with Linked Account Call Preparations,\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Call Plans and issues resolution.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Communicate business issues and possible alternatives to BASF management in a timely manner and work with the appropriate BASF areas to implement solutions.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Support, cooperate and closely coordinate actions and plans with functions such as sales, marketing and technical teams to ensure objectives align with accounts and are achieved.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  In a team based environment, collaborate with Regional Sales Management to ensure alignment of account plan objectives, initiatives and activities are clearly communicated and executed at the field level. \n selling to distributors.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Demonstrated success in budget management in a sales environment.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Strong As a member of the Pesticide Team, you will provide regulatory leadership to the Product Stewardship and Regulatory Affairs community and regional\u002Fglobal business groups which will enable antimicrobial and inert compliance and business advantage in existing and new markets.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>In this role you will be responsible for North America regional antimicrobial and inert regulatory services including pesticide program elements, monitoring changes in regulations, product compliance assessments, registration strategies, notifications, agency reporting, training, advocacy, customer support and incident investigations. These activities have a high technical complexity and impact for BASF.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Formula for Success: You Will…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Leverage your product regulatory and\u002For technical skills you will act as a North American pesticide product regulatory expert and develop, implement, and maintain pesticide programs, procedures, training and support nonconformance investigations for relevant businesses.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Demonstrate your excellent project management skills, you will lead\u002Fsupport cross-functional, technically challenging North America antimicrobial and inert registrations.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Your effective verbal and written communication skills will serve you well as you advise business management on regulatory issues impacting company sales and profit and provide expertise on alternative regulatory strategies that can benefit the business.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Leverage your educational and\u002For professional background in chemistry, microbiology, toxicology or related field will aid you to defend and maintain existing antimicrobial products registered in the U.S., Canada and Mexico and support the commercialization of new and amended registered products to ensure BASF’s license to sell.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Your experience and skills will aid you in conducting inert\u002Fformulant compliance assessments and preparing U.S. and Canada inert\u002Fformulant petitions as you collaborate with regional\u002Fglobal business and technical management, serving as the regulatory contact with agencies.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Your collaboration skills will ensure successful engagement within and outside the organization, you will provide regulatory support and expertise to internal technical and business managers, agency personnel, customers, trade organization members.\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Apply your comprehensive working knowledge of antimicrobial and inert regulations, you will develop employee training content. \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer In this diversity lies our greatest strength.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We provide a fulfilling work environment with a strong emphasis on the physical and psychological safety of our employees and the communities we operate in. We have also been recognized as Canada’s Safest Employer in Chemical Manufacturing for several consecutive years, in addition to receiving a Bronze medal for providing a Psychologically Safe workplace. Most recently, we were thrilled to be recognized as a Forbes 2022 Canada’s Best Employers for Diversity.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We invite you to join our best team on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Human Resources Business Partner – Windsor, Ontario<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Where the Chemistry Happens<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Coatings is a fast-paced and dynamic business environment where we recognize diversity as a competitive advantage. You can expect to be challenged, supported, and coached for professional growth and development during your career with us.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>This is an exciting time to join the Coatings HR Team! You will have a direct impact on our ability to attract, develop and retain strong and diverse internal and external talent. You will be a trusted and credible business advisor to the leaders and employees supported, as well as a culture steward of our organizational ability to promote an engaged, empowered, and inclusive work environment.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Formula for Success: You Will…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Manage and lead the full range of day-to-day HR and Labor Relations support required for the site to achieve its strategic and tactical objectives<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide employee and labor relations, organizational development, HR advice and counsel to employees and managers, talent and performance management, compensation administration, policy interpretation and administration and recruiting oversight<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely and collaboratively with the Site Director and Labor Relations Specialist<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support specific LR activities including contract administration, internal investigations, conflict resolution, grievance, disciplinary and termination processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Serve as a member of the Windsor Site Leadership Team<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support BASF, regional, and EC HR initiatives as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in ECN HR meetings as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support ECR Sales &amp; Distribution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Execute responsibilities in compliance with all relevant federal, state, and local employment and labor laws<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Labor Relations, Organizational Development, Business Administration or other related discipline<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum of 8 years’ progressive HR\u002FLabor Relations experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong knowledge of applicable federal, state, and local employment and labor laws<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Intermediate to advanced level proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills with ability to maintain confidential and sensitive information as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proactive and collaborative team player with a bias for action<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to learn and develop business acumen<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent problem-solving skills with strong customer-focused approach<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you – the whole you – in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. <p><b>We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Créez votre propre chimie : ce que nous vous offrons<\u002Fb> <b>Chez BASF<\u002Fb>, nous créons de la chimie en reliant les esprits. En recherchant la prospérité tout en protégeant l’environnement et en assumant nos responsabilités sociales, nous bâtissons un avenir plus durable en faisant appel à la chimie. En notre qualité de première firme de chimie au monde, nous aidons nos clients, dans pratiquement tous les secteurs, à répondre aux besoins courants et futurs de la société grâce à la science et à l’innovation.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>Nous assurons un environnement de travail épanouissant en mettant l’accent sur la sécurité de nos employés et des sociétés dans lesquelles nous exerçons nos activités. Nous nous efforçons toujours de constituer la meilleure équipe en insistant sur la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion, ainsi que sur l’apprentissage et le perfectionnement tout au long de la vie.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Nous nous efforçons constamment d’améliorer le milieu de travail. En 2022, BASF figure fièrement parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada et dans la région du Grand Toronto, un honneur qui se perpétue depuis de nombreuses années. Nous avons également été récemment honorés comme l’un des employeurs les plus sûrs du Canada, et nous nous sommes vu décerner la médaille de bronze du prix du milieu de travail qui favorise la sécurité psychologique des employés. Plus récemment, nous avons été ravis d’être reconnus comme l’un des meilleurs employeurs du Canada pour la diversité de Forbes 2022.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>AgSolutions Représentant de détail (2203776)<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>La chimie à l’œuvre<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>En occupant le poste de représentant d’entreprise au sein de notre Division des solutions agricoles, vous pourrez marier vos expériences professionnelles de la vente et des techniques dans le but de promouvoir les innovations de BASF qui sont à la tête du secteur à nos clients dans les domaines de la vente au détail et de l’agriculture.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Relevant du directeur régional des ventes, est du Canada, le représentant d’entreprise doit accélérer la croissance du volume de vente, assurer l’entretien des produits de BASF, ainsi que nouer et cultiver des relations avec un réseau établi de détaillants. En travaillant à domicile, vous serez tenu d’atteindre vos objectifs en matière de vente dans votre territoire.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>La recette du succès : vos responsabilités<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Réaliser les objectifs de vente de Produit au sol stratégiques désignés dans le processus de planification du rendement et situés dans le territoire établi.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Développer sur le terrain le marché des produits applicables en vous livrant, entre autres, aux activités suivantes : former les détaillants, les visiter, rencontrer certains détaillants et certains producteurs agricoles, et assister aux foires agricoles.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Répondre rapidement et de façon professionnelle aux questions des détaillants et des agriculteurs sur les produits, et régler leurs problèmes de façon tout aussi rapide et professionnelle. À l’aide de la base de données, cibler, mettre à jour et enregistrer les renseignements, et organiser des activités pour les détaillants et les producteurs agricoles;<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Respecter les budgets des dépenses du territoire (initiatives liées aux déplacements, rencontres de clients éventuels, etc.) et nouer des relations avec les clients à l’aide de ces initiatives.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Le secret de notre succès : qualités que nous attendons de vous<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Goût de changer les choses dans le domaine de l’agriculture.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Diplôme universitaire en agriculture ou dans une science connexe, en affaires ou en commerce, et de 3 à 5 ans d’expérience connexe.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Bon entregent et capacité de nouer des relations significatives et fructueuses avec la clientèle et vos collègues.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Bien savoir communiquer à l’oral et à l’écrit, savoir faire de bonnes présentations et avoir déjà travaillé sur les logiciels de Microsoft Office (Word, Excel et PowerPoint) dans votre milieu de travail.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Être disposé à voyager régulièrement la nuit.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Savoir gérer votre temps et vos priorités afin de réaliser vos objectifs en matière de ventes.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Titre de Conseiller certifié en culture ou de Consultant certifié en phytologie, un atout.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Nous encourageons tous les postulants à poser leur candidature. BASF a pour politique de ne pas ménager ses efforts pour adapter son milieu de travail aux employés ayant besoin qu’on prenne pour eux des mesures particulières afin qu’ils puissent exécuter leurs tâches essentielles. En particulier, les employés handicapés ont droit à un processus de recrutement et à des documents accessibles.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Créez votre propre chimie : ce que nous vous offrons<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Ajouter de la valeur à nos clients signifie en fait que nous commençons par nous occuper de nos employés. You@BASF vous offre une panoplie d’avantages, d’à côtés, de programmes et d’occasions uniques à toutes les étapes de votre vie et de votre carrière. Grâce à you@BASF, vous créez votre propre chimie.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Toutes les récompenses que nous remettons à un employé BASF sont de loin plus importantes que le chèque de paie. De nos régimes de santé et d’assurances collectives à nos solides prestations de retraite qui comprennent des cotisations égales versées par l’entreprise, des programmes d’apprentissage tout au long de la vie, nous croyons que nous investissons dans notre réussite lorsque nous investissons en vous. En travaillant pour une entreprise d’envergure mondiale, vous pourrez, si vous le désirez, croître sur les plans personnel et professionnel, élargir votre réseau et mener une carrière dynamique et enrichissante. Nous offrons également des occasions d’apprentissage et de perfectionnement intéressantes pour vous aider à tirer le meilleur parti de vos talents et de votre emploi.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Inclusion et égalité des chances en matière d’emploi<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>BASF s’engage à instaurer un lieu de travail diversifié et inclusif où les employés n’ont pas à cacher qui ils sont. Nous sommes un employeur soucieux de l’égalité des chances et tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en compte pour un emploi sans considération de race, d’âge, de citoyenneté, de lieu d’origine, d’origine ethnique, de couleur, de religion, de croyance, de genre, de la possibilité de grossesse, d’état matrimonial, de situation familiale, de handicap, d’orientation sexuelle, d’identité ou d’expression de genre, ou de toute autre caractéristique protégée par la loi.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Nous nous efforçons de rendre notre processus de recrutement accessible aux personnes handicapées. Si vous avez besoin d’aménagements ou de soutien tout au long du processus de recrutement, veuillez nous envoyer un courriel à ta-canada@basf.com en indiquant dans l’objet « Demande d’aménagement pour le recrutement.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Déclaration de confidentialité<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp> BASF prend la sécurité et la confidentialité des données très au sérieux. Nous ne demanderons jamais d'informations personnelles ou financières de quelque nature que ce soit par courriel, message texte privé ou message direct sur une plate-forme de médias sociaux ou un site d'emploi. De plus, nous n'offrirons jamais un poste à un candidat et ne demanderons jamais un chèque pour de l'équipement ou tout autre type de paiement pendant le processus de demande d'emploi. Si vous avez été victime de l'une des situations ci-dessus, veuillez communiquer avec myhr@basf.com pour signaler une <p><b>We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Créez votre propre chimie : ce que nous vous offrons<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Chez BASF<\u002Fb>, nous créons de la chimie en reliant les esprits. En recherchant la prospérité tout en protégeant l’environnement et en assumant nos responsabilités sociales, nous bâtissons un avenir plus durable en faisant appel à la chimie. En notre qualité de première firme de chimie au monde, nous aidons nos clients, dans pratiquement tous les secteurs, à répondre aux besoins courants et futurs de la société grâce à la science et à l’innovation.\n <p><\u002Fp> Nous assurons un environnement de travail épanouissant en mettant l’accent sur la sécurité de nos employés et des sociétés dans lesquelles exerçons nos activités. Nous nous efforçons toujours de constituer la meilleure équipe en insistant sur la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion, ainsi que sur l’apprentissage et le perfectionnement tout au long de la vie. \n <p><\u002Fp>Nous nous efforçons constamment d’améliorer le milieu de travail. En 2022, BASF figure fièrement parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada et dans la région du Grand Toronto, un honneur qui se perpétue depuis de nombreuses années. Nous avons également été récemment honorés comme l’un des employeurs les plus sûrs du Canada, et nous nous sommes vu décerner la médaille de bronze du prix du milieu de travail qui favorise la sécurité psychologique des employés. \n <p><\u002Fp>Nous vous invitons à grossir nos rangs d’experts pour créer des solutions en vue d’un futur durable!\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Directeur du développement des affaires, Québec et Est du Canada – Québec à distance<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>La chimie à l’œuvre<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>En tant que directeur du développement des affaires, vous serez responsable de l'élaboration et de l'exécution de la stratégie de marché et de croissance pour les diverses activités de BASF (allant de l'exploitation minière, de l'automobile, des produits pharmaceutiques, des soins personnels et de la fabrication) au Québec. Cela inclura le développement et la gestion de grands comptes basés au Québec. En tant que tel, vous devrez parler couramment l'anglais et Français. \n <p><\u002Fp>Vous serez responsable de fournir des informations exploitables, des analyses de marché et des renseignements sur la concurrence pour BASF au Canada en utilisant les sources de données existantes et par le biais de nouvelles recherches primaires et secondaires. Cela comprendra la taille du marché, l'industrie et le paysage concurrentiel et les domaines de croissance des entreprises.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>La recette du succès : vos responsabilités<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Responsable de l'élaboration et de l'exécution de la stratégie de croissance du Québec : recherche et développement d'opportunités de marché au Québec pour les entreprises de BASF\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Gérer et développer les relations avec la clientèle au Québec\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Étude de marché et analyse du paysage de l'industrie chimique canadienne\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Développer des présentations avec des informations exploitables en tirant parti des études de marché menées qui incluent les opportunités de marché, le dimensionnement et la segmentation, le paysage concurrentiel sur les marchés finaux canadiens pertinents pour BASF \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Le secret de notre succès : qualités que nous attendons de vous<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Baccalauréat en sciences, en génie, en affaires ou dans des domaines connexes\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  MBA ou Master en sciences \u002F ingénierie, affaires ou domaines connexes est considéré comme un atout\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Expérience préalable en études de marché de préférence dans l'industrie chimique\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Expérience en vente \u002F marketing \u002F développement des affaires\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Expérience démontrée dans l'identification et le développement de relations avec les clients\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Connaissance de l'industrie chimique, de préférence au Canada\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Qualifié dans les études de marché primaires et secondaires\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Aptitude à développer des présentations convaincantes avec des informations exploitables\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Aptitude à engager et à établir des relations avec les parties prenantes internes et externes\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Créez votre propre chimie : ce que nous vous offrons<\u002Fb>\n <p><\u002Fp> Ajouter de la valeur à nos clients signifie en fait que nous commençons par nous occuper de nos employés. You@BASF vous offre une panoplie d’avantages, d’à‑côtés, de programmes et d’occasions uniques à toutes les étapes de votre vie et de votre carrière. Grâce à you@BASF, vous créez votre propre chimie.\n <p><\u002Fp> Toutes les récompenses que nous remettons à un employé BASF sont de loin plus importantes que le chèque de paie. De nos régimes de santé et d’assurances collectives à nos solides prestations de retraite qui comprennent des cotisations égales versées par l’entreprise, des programmes d’apprentissage tout au long de la vie, nous croyons que nous investissons dans notre réussite lorsque nous investissons en vous. En travaillant pour une entreprise d’envergure mondiale, vous pourrez, si vous le désirez, croître sur les plans personnel et professionnel, élargir votre réseau et mener une carrière dynamique et enrichissante. Nous offrons également des occasions d’apprentissage et de perfectionnement intéressantes pour vous aider à tirer le meilleur parti de vos talents et de votre emploi.\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <b>Inclusion et égalité des chances en matière d’emploi<\u002Fb>\n <p><\u002Fp> BASF s’engage à instaurer un lieu de travail diversifié et inclusif où les employés n’ont pas à cacher qui ils sont. Nous sommes un employeur soucieux de l’égalité des chances et tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en compte pour un emploi sans considération de race, d’âge, de citoyenneté, de lieu d’origine, d’origine ethnique, de couleur, de religion, de croyance, de genre, de la possibilité de grossesse, d’état matrimonial, de situation familiale, de handicap, d’orientation sexuelle, d’identité ou d’expression de genre, ou de toute autre caractéristique protégée par la loi.\n <p><\u002Fp> Nous nous efforçons de rendre notre processus de recrutement accessible aux personnes handicapées. Si vous avez besoin d’aménagements ou de soutien tout au long du processus de recrutement, veuillez nous envoyer un courriel à ta-canada@basf.com en indiquant dans l’objet « Demande d’aménagement pour le recrutement <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Wage: $21.00 hour to $28.00 hour.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b> Responsibilities:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>As an Agronomic Associate, you will join our Agronomy team where you will be involved in:\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>Field trials for local Agronomic Excellence programs evaluating canola hybrids and seed technology with goal of developing regional hybrid specific agronomic practices.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>You will be responsible for field activities relating to hybrid evaluation on a commercial scale to small plot trials from seeding to harvest including seed set up, land preparation, seeding, pest control, plot maintenance, harvesting and supervision of casual employees as required.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>You will also be involved in crop health diagnosis through daily monitoring of field and research plots, data collection and analysis.\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>You can be part of an inclusive team of diverse talent and character. In this diversity lies our greatest strength.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We provide a fulfilling work environment with a strong emphasis on the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in. We are always working to form the best team with an emphasis on diversity, equity and inclusion and through lifelong learning and development.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been proudly recognized as one of Canada's &amp; GTA’s Best 100 Employers in 2022 and for many consecutive years. We have also recently been honored as one of Canada’s Safest Employers in addition to a Bronze winner of the Psychologically Safe Workplace award.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>We invite you to join our best team on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Technical Service Specialist (Representative)<\u002Fb> - Quebec - Remote, with travel to customers required\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <b>Where the Chemistry Happens…<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>The Technical Service Specialist will be responsible for the development of new accounts and maintenance of existing accounts in the Specialty &amp; Industrial Markets. You will provide critical account development support, including technical support and training to BASF distributors and end-users.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>You will also be responsible for the introduction and implementation of various value-added service products from sales, marketing and technical departments into the field, while ensuring that distributors and end-users are well-versed on the products.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <b>Formula for Success: You Will…<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Plan and implement target account activity within the Specialty &amp; Industrial Markets. You will lead cross-functional, cross-regional project teams throughout project phases in a global environment.\n <p><\u002Fp> These will range from complex projects to small programs, and you will oversee them in every project phase from initiation to close, taking responsibility for them being delivered on time and in budget, scope and quality. To that end, you will support the assessment of the requirements to operate a company in the BASF group and develop integration\u002Fdivestiture scenarios. Furthermore, you will develop other project managers, which you will contribute to through coaching.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Formula for Success: You Will…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Partner for the sponsor and other stakeholders to deliver the project successfully\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Understands and lead project with focus on business targets\n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Be responsible for delivering complete project in time, budget, scope and quality\n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Drive delivery model considering BASF Digital Services strategy targets\n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Lead large cross-functional, cross-regional project team throughout the project phases in a global environment including teams outside BASF Digital Services \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Take responsibility to setup project organization, identify relevant roles and staff the project team\n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  Adhere and enable project process compliance. <p><b>We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Créez votre propre chimie : ce que nous vous offrons<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <b>Chez BASF<\u002Fb>, nous créons de la chimie en reliant les esprits. En recherchant la prospérité tout en protégeant l’environnement et en assumant nos responsabilités sociales, nous bâtissons un avenir plus durable en faisant appel à la chimie. En notre qualité de première firme de chimie au monde, nous aidons nos clients, dans pratiquement tous les secteurs, à répondre aux besoins courants et futurs de la société grâce à la science et à l’innovation.\n <p><\u002Fp> Nous assurons un environnement de travail épanouissant en mettant l’accent sur la sécurité de nos employés et des sociétés dans lesquelles exerçons nos activités. Nous nous efforçons toujours de constituer la meilleure équipe en insistant sur la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion, ainsi que sur l’apprentissage et le perfectionnement tout au long de la vie. \n <p><\u002Fp>Nous nous efforçons constamment d’améliorer le milieu de travail. En 2022, BASF figure fièrement parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada et dans la région du Grand Toronto, un honneur qui se perpétue depuis de nombreuses années. Nous avons également été récemment honorés comme l’un des employeurs les plus sûrs du Canada, et nous nous sommes vu décerner la médaille de bronze du prix du milieu de travail qui favorise la sécurité psychologique des employés. \n <p><\u002Fp>Nous vous invitons à grossir nos rangs d’experts pour créer des solutions en vue d’un futur durable!\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <b>Spécialiste (représentant.e) des services techniques<\u002Fb> - Québec - À distance, avec déplacement aux clients requis\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <b><i>La chimie à l’œuvre<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <p><\u002Fp> Le\u002FLa spécialiste des services techniques sera responsable de la création de comptes et du maintien des comptes existants pour ce qui est des marchés des spécialités et des secteurs industriels. Vous fournirez un soutien au développement de comptes essentiels, y compris le soutien technique et une formation aux distributeurs et aux utilisateurs finaux de BASF.\n <p><\u002Fp> Il vous incombera également d’introduire et de mettre en œuvre divers produits à valeur ajoutée en matière de services, soit dans les secteurs des ventes, du marketing et des services techniques, tout en vous assurant que les distributeurs et les utilisateurs finaux connaissent bien les produits. \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>La recette du succès : vos responsabilités<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Planifier et mettre en œuvre l’activité du compte cible sur les marchés industriels et des spécialités. Vous devrez, entre autres, mettre au point la stratégie ainsi que préparer les présentations et les propositions de vente. De plus, il vous faudra procéder à cette planification et à cette mise en œuvre lors de la conclusion de la vente.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Gérer les activités de développement des affaires, y compris créer des comptes et maintenir les comptes courants.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Fournir un soutien important aux distributeurs entrepositaires, aux grossistes et aux utilisateurs finaux de BASF.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Vendre et mettre en œuvre des procédures et des processus pertinents destinés aux utilisateurs finaux.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Recommander un portefeuille des produits pour les comptes cibles, en faire la démonstration et fournir de la formation pratique sur les produits à utiliser.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborer avec les secteurs des ventes, du marketing et de la formation en vue de créer des produits et programmes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Rester au fait des transformations industrielles en ce qui concerne les processus, les produits et les occasions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Rehausser le service à la clientèle en communiquant régulièrement avec les plus importants services de soutien.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Fournir des rapports mensuels sur les activités et le rendement de croissance du compte.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Vous associer aux équipes de vente régionales et aux experts en développement des affaires en les faisant participer à l’harmonisation de l’approche courante qui pourra favoriser la croissance du compte cible.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><i> Le secret de notre succès : qualités que nous attendons de vous<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>D’excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite, tant en français qu’en anglais, y compris des capacités supérieures en présentation.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum de trois ans d’expérience en ventes, de préférence dans le secteur du revêtement.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Des études postsecondaires (y compris dans les métiers) sont exigées, idéalement avec une spécialisation en administration des affaires ou en vente et marketing.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Connaissances minimales des applications informatiques de Lotus Notes et de la suite MS Office au niveau intermédiaire.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b><i>Créez votre propre chimie : ce que nous vous offrons<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <p><\u002Fp> Ajouter de la valeur à nos clients signifie en fait que nous commençons par nous occuper de nos employés. You@BASF vous offre une panoplie d’avantages, d’à‑côtés, de programmes et d’occasions uniques à toutes les étapes de votre vie et de votre carrière. Grâce à you@BASF, vous créez votre propre chimie.\n <p><\u002Fp> Toutes les récompenses que nous remettons à un employé BASF sont de loin plus importantes que le chèque de paie. De nos régimes de santé et d’assurances collectives à nos solides prestations de retraite qui comprennent des cotisations égales versées par l’entreprise, des programmes d’apprentissage tout au long de la vie, nous croyons que nous investissons dans notre réussite lorsque nous investissons en vous. En travaillant pour une entreprise d’envergure mondiale, vous pourrez, si vous le désirez, croître sur les plans personnel et professionnel, élargir votre réseau et mener une carrière dynamique et enrichissante. Nous offrons également des occasions d’apprentissage et de perfectionnement intéressantes pour vous aider à tirer le meilleur parti de vos talents et de votre emploi.\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b><i>Inclusion et égalité des chances en matière d’emploi<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n <p><\u002Fp> BASF s’engage à instaurer un lieu de travail diversifié et inclusif où les employés n’ont pas à cacher qui ils sont. Nous sommes un employeur soucieux de l’égalité des chances et tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en compte pour un emploi sans considération de race, d’âge, de citoyenneté, de lieu d’origine, d’origine ethnique, de couleur, de religion, de croyance, de genre, de la possibilité de grossesse, d’état matrimonial, de situation familiale, de handicap, d’orientation sexuelle, d’identité ou d’expression de genre, ou de toute autre caractéristique protégée par la loi.\n <p><\u002Fp> Nous nous efforçons de rendre notre processus de recrutement accessible aux personnes handicapées. Si vous avez besoin d’aménagements ou de soutien tout au long du processus de recrutement, veuillez nous envoyer un courriel à ta-canada@basf.com en indiquant dans l’objet « Demande d’aménagement pour le recrutement
